channel.title: Can't partition my hard drive for Ubuntu
channel.description:
Well I'm trying to install Ubuntu so I can dual boot it with Windows XP. I'm following [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,127806.0.html]Ron's guide[/url] and I'm at step 6, trying to create a partition out of unallocated space and format it as swap. However, it simply won't let me. I have the free, unallocated space but when I try to create a partition out of it, I just can't.
[IMG]http://img473.imageshack.us/img473/8517/untitledfd9.png[/img]
You can see I have the Linux Ext part formed and I have the unallocated 2 GB or so of space. But when I try to format it as swap I get this stupid crap:
[IMG]http://img213.imageshack.us/img213/5310/untitled2yk0.png[/img]
No idea why the hell I can't just format the fucking free space. Any help is appreciated.

item.title: Can't partition my hard drive for Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

Yes, it is. You can download the .iso install file to burn from a CD and install it that way or you can order CD’s. Both Ubuntu and Kubuntu install CD’s are free (they’re two different Linux operating systems). You can order a free Ubuntu CD here and you can order a free Kbuntu CD here. You can also check out other Linux distros if you want.

Read full topic

item.source: Can't partition my hard drive for Ubuntu

item.title: Can't partition my hard drive for Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

You can only have 4 primary partitions, if you have 4 already one has to be turned into a logical partition, which further partitions can be created in and only count towards 1 of the limit. However, I believe /boot has to be in a primary partition.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't partition my hard drive for Ubuntu

item.title: Can't partition my hard drive for Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Put your live cd in, restart computer, click install on live cd desktop. And just leave it as defualt.

Read full topic

item.title: Can't partition my hard drive for Ubuntu
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I had the exact same problem, but all you need to do is “unformat” the linux ext3 and create an ‘extended partition’ and create the ext3 and swap partitions under that.

I honestly can’t remember how i did it now, but I’m trying to remember,

Read full topic
